meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm just gonna dive right in and tell you that Octopath Traveler is the real MVP when it comes to bringing back the nostalgia of those golden days of JRPGs (you know, like Chrono Trigger, Final Fantasy VI, and all that jazz). But don't get me wrong, this game isn't just some lazy rehashing of old ideas – nope! It's got fresh takes, new mechanics, and a whole lot of charm packed in.

Now, I'm not gonna give you the full rundown on what makes Octopath Traveler so great (although, if you want to know more, I can totally go into details), but let me just say that it's like someone took all my favorite childhood memories and mashed 'em up with some modern sensibilities. The battle system? Awesome. The pixel art? Jaw-droppingly gorgeous. And don't even get me started on the soundtrack – I mean, have you heard those orchestral beats?!

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about the storytelling?" Ah, yes! Well, let's just say that it's not perfect (I mean, who needs a coherent narrative when you've got awesome battle mechanics and art style, am I right?), but hey, at least it tries! And besides, with eight different characters to follow, there's plenty of room for interpretation and personal preference.

So, what do the critics say? Well, let me just give you some highlights (because, honestly, who doesn't love a good highlight reel?). IGN gave it a solid 93, saying it's "a JRPG dream come true" with loving tributes to the Super NES era. GameSpot went for an 80, calling it "one of the most interesting and effective re-imaginings of a retro aesthetic around." And Nintendo Life chimed in with its own 90, saying it's an "absolute must buy."

Of course, not everyone was singing along – like that one critic who said something about the narrative leaving room for improvement (yawn), or another who just kinda shrugged and called it "a nice try" ( zzz...). But hey, I mean, what do they know? They're just critics! You, on the other hand, are a discerning gamer with refined tastes – and if that's the case, then you should totally give Octopath Traveler a spin!

That is all.
